column4: My ubuntu keeps freezing up. Maybe once per day. audio always loops and you must force restart
How can I figure out why my computer froze?
does it only freeze when you are using certain programmes, or does it happen at random?
I have my system monitors on and nothing irregular happens. No spikes or anything
In ram or processor that is
have you checked your system logs to see if anything weird is being recorded in them?
if you open a terminal and go to /var/log , you will find various logs in there containing details of your system, messages from the kernel and so on
What would I be looking for?
Anything happening to your system would likely be in your syslog - perhaps look for errors in the log file, or maybe in the output from your kernel.
I have no idea on that one, never seen it or read it :)
if you did that as root, you lost whatever you did it on, trinimoses
I see that the time that it froze my network manager completing-> group handshake
are you connecting via Wireless or via a cabled connection?
